comment.author: 12814971@N00
comment._content: Slightly strange Russian pre-dred Graf Apraksin aground in the Gulf of Finland, 1899. Her future was not much more rosy. Part of Rozhestvensky's "fleet that had to die" she was captured by the Japanese at Tsushima, and served that nation until being decommissioned and turned into a museum in 1924. Severely damaged by a storm in 1939 she was finally scrapped.
